intro: Schefflera elachistocephala, commonly known as the dwarf umbrella plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Araliaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, including regions of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its compact size and distinctive, umbrella-like arrangement of leaves. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by round, fleshy fruits. This species is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
